verses.verse: A Prayer of Moses the man of God. Lord<WH136>, thou hast been our dwelling-place<WH4583> In all<WH1755> generations<WH1755>.

Before the mountains<WH2022> were brought forth<WH3205>, Or ever thou hadst formed<WH2342> the earth<WH776> and the world<WH8398>, Even from everlasting<WH5769> to<WH5704> everlasting<WH5769>, thou art God<WH410>.
Thou turnest<WH7725> man<WH582> to destruction<WH1793>, And sayest<WH559>, Return<WH7725>, ye children<WH1121> of men<WH120>.
For a thousand<WH505> years<WH8141> in thy sight<WH5869> Are but as<WH3117> yesterday<WH865> when it is past<WH5674>, And as a watch<WH821> in the night<WH3915>.
Thou carriest them away as with a flood<WH2229>; they are as a sleep<WH8142>: In the morning<WH1242> they are like grass<WH2682> which groweth up<WH2498>.
In the morning<WH1242> it flourisheth<WH6692>, and groweth up<WH2498>; In the evening<WH6153> it is cut down<WH4135>, and withereth<WH3001>.
For we are consumed<WH3615> in thine anger<WH639>, And in thy wrath<WH2534> are we troubled<WH926>.
Thou hast set<WH7896> our iniquities<WH5771> before thee<WH5956>, Our secret sins in the light<WH3974> of thy countenance<WH6440>.
For all our days<WH3117> are passed away<WH6437> in thy wrath<WH5678>: We bring<WH3615> our years<WH8141> to an end as a sigh<WH1899>.

The days<WH3117> of our years<WH8141> are threescore<WH7657> years<WH8141> and ten<WH7657>, Or even by reason of strength<WH1369> fourscore<WH8084> years<WH8141>; Yet is their pride<WH7296> but labor<WH5999> and sorrow<WH205>; For it is soon<WH2440> gone<WH1468>, and we fly away<WH5774>.
Who knoweth<WH3045> the power<WH5797> of thine anger<WH639>, And thy wrath<WH5678> according to the fear that is due unto thee<WH3374>?
So teach<WH3045> us to number<WH4487> our days<WH3117>, That we may get<WH935> us a heart<WH3824> of wisdom<WH2451>.
Return <WH7725>, O Jehovah<WH3068>; How long<WH5162>? And let it repent thee concerning thy servants<WH5650>.
Oh satisfy<WH7646> us in the morning<WH1242> with thy lovingkindness<WH2617>, That we may rejoice<WH7442> and be glad<WH8055> all our days<WH3117>.
Make us glad<WH8055> according to the days<WH3117> wherein thou hast afflicted<WH6031> us<WH8141>, And the years wherein we have seen<WH7200> evil<WH7451>.
Let thy work<WH6467> appear<WH7200> unto thy servants<WH5650>, And thy glory<WH1926> upon their children<WH1121>.

And let the favor<WH5278> of the Lord<WH3068> our God<WH430> be upon us<WH3559>; And establish thou the work<WH4639> of our hands<WH3027> upon us<WH4639>; Yea, the work of our hands<WH3027> establish thou it<WH3559>.
